Given the lack of electricity in their community, they usually purchase lighting sources such as fuel and batteries to feed their light sources, which is not only expensive but also impractical.  By purchasing a solar home system, Leticia and her group will have a better quality of life.  Also, the solar home system will allow them to improve the family's economic situation by allowing them to perform productive activities once the sun has set.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will substitute de use of batteries and fuel.

loans.name: Artemio's Group

texts.en:
Artemio and Baldrades live in the community of “Adolfo Lopez Mateos” in the state of Campeche.  It is a very poor community with almost no access to electricity. 
Their whole lives they have lived in conditions of poverty.  

Both Artemio and Baldrades harvest corn and zucchini, and raise farm animals for a living.  They have to face the same problem of having an inconsistent income because the money they receive from agriculture depends on the prices of the products at the time. 

Given the lack of electricity in their community, they usually purchase lighting sources such as fuel and batteries to feed their light sources.  This is not only expensive but also impractical and unhealthy.  By purchasing a solar home system, they will be able to save money in the long term and improve their family's economic situation.  They will also be able to perform productive activities once the sun has set.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow them reduce household spending.

loans.name: Roquelina

texts.es:
Roquelina viene de una familia muy trabajadora, que desde pequeña le han enseñado el valor del trabajo, como un medio de poder salir adelante.
Hoy ella está siguiendo la carrera de enfermería, con la que quiere poder ayudar a su familia y tener mejores ingresos. Es una mujer muy luchadora que está esforzando por sobresalir y ser el día de mañana una profesional destacada.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas de universidad y así seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Roquelina comes from a very hard-working family. From a young age, they taught her the value of work as a means to move forward.

Now, she is starting a career in nursing. She hopes that this will help her family and provide her with more income. Roquelina is a hard-working woman who is making a continuous effort to succeed and become a noted professional.

She is requesting this loan to invest in payments for college so she can keep going to school.

loans.use: to make payments for college.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa cuenta que gracias al apoyo de su mama pudo estudiar, y es ella quien la inspira a seguir sus metas y poder convertirse el día de mañana en una profesional que ayude a las demás personas.
Comenta que siempre se esfuerza por poder sobresalir y ser una alumna destacada en sus estudios. Pide de este crédito para poder cubrir las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder estudiando y luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Rosa says that she is grateful for her mom's support, which allowed her to go to school. Her mom inspires her to work toward her goals to become a professional someday and help others.

She says that she always works to succeed and be a top student in school. She is requesting this loan to make payments for college so she can keep going to school and working toward her goals.

loans.use: to make payments for college.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
La Sra. Rafaela, es dueña de un negocio familiar, tiene una despensa, atiende su local ayudada por su hija, también tiene un hijo mayor que trabaja de manera independiente. Ella es una señora muy emprendedora y responsable con los compromisos que asume, y se destaca en el barrio por ser una persona muy amable que ayuda a los demás. Su meta es poder tener un negocio mayor y de esa forma seguir dando a su familia en apoyo que necesita.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser panificados, carne, bebidas, verduras, y demás, y así poder seguir con su venta y tener una mejor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rafaela is the owner of a family business.  She has a store which she tends to along with her daughter.  She also has an adult son who works independently.  Rafaela is a very enterprising woman who is responsible with the obligations that she takes on.  In her neighborhood, she stands out as being a very kind person who helps others.  Her goal is to have a bigger store so that she could give her family the support they need.

Rafaela is requesting this loan to invest in products for her store, such as: bread products, meat, drinks, vegetables, and other products.  This way she can continue with her sales and have a greater variety of products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy bread products, meat, drinks, vegetables, and other items

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Salamatu. She is married and has two children, ages four and ten years old. She has one additional dependant, a sister's child who lives with her to get help with her education. 

In 2009, Salamatu established her business selling groceries, drinks, cosmetics and toiletries. She began her business to be self-reliant and help her husband with running the affairs of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 2,525,000 SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Salamatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to add drinks to her inventory. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve stock and increase profits. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand the business to the sale of imported rice. She started the business in a stall and now has a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional drinks.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Rugiatu. She is divorced and has two children, ages 7 and 13. She has one additional dependant, who lives with her to help with the house chores. In 2005, Rugiatu established her business selling groceries, drinks, toiletries and cooking condiments. She began her business to be self-reliant after being divorced from her husband. Her business is located in the city's outskirts and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,056,860 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Rugiatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy drinks. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve the business and increase profits. In the future, Rugiatu plans to expand the business to the sale of imported rice. She started business in a stall and now has a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has four children, ages one, four, eight and ten years old. In 1999, Kadiatu established her cooking condiments business. She started the business to help her husband with running the affairs of the home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults .Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 1,289,040 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid six loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy cooking condiments. She hopes that this loan can improve the business and raise profits. In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand the business to a shop. She started the business selling palm oil and now sells cooking condiments. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cooking condiments.

loans.name: Zarah

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Zarah. She is married and has two children ages five and ten years old. Zarah changed her business from ladies wear to men's clothing. In 2005, Zarah established her business selling men's shoes, jeans, t-shirts and shirts. The business was started to help her husband with running the affairs of the home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 1,607,187 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Zarah has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy jeans, men's shoes and t-shirts. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve the business and increase profits. In the future, Zarah plans to to expand the business to a boutique. She started the business selling ladies slippers and now sells men's clothing. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, men's shoes and t-shirts for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu. She is 32 years old and from the Waterloo2 eastern area of Freetown. She is married with 4 children.  In 2008, Kadiatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income.   She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a poor network within her operation area.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a foodstuffs table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Shehu. He is married and has four children, ages five, seven, ten and 14 years old. In 2010, Shehu established his used clothing and toiletries sales business. He began his business to be self-reliant after graduating from computer school. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about 1,257,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Shehu has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy used clothing. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase stock and expand the business. In the future, Shehu plans to improve the business and expand to other areas of town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used clothing.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Hawa from Waterloo2 eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children. She started her business to take care of her family. 

Hawa runs a fish vending business at home; she sells fish within her community. She has been running this business since 2009. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Hawa says that the main challenges to her business are the cost of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Hawa has requested a loan in order to buy more fish for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Abdul R.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. Together, they have applied for a loan of 12,200,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Abdul is the featured leader of this group of borrowers. A native of Manolo, the 46-year-old is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Abdul has requested a loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to pay school fees for his children and will use the rest of the loan to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, cement, iron rods, etc., for the construction of a home.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and use the rest of the loan to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, cement, iron rods, etc., for construction of a home.

loans.name: Angela A.'s Group

texts.en:
In the picture above are teachers from the the small town of Waterloo, in western Sierra Leone. Together, they have come to SMT, Kiva’s oldest field partner, to apply for a loan of 7,000,000 SLL, in order to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Angela is the featured leader of this group of teachers. The 57-year-old is a native of Freetown. She is a widow with two children. Angela has been a school teacher for 22 years now. She has requested this loan in order to pay her college fees.

loans.use: to pay her college fees.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.es:
Emanuel es una persona que se esfuerza por poder crecer y salir adelante, quiere ser un buen profesional y así poder ser útil a la sociedad.
Está estudiando la carrera de diseño y comunicación, y comenta que por medio de esta carrera quiere crecer y mejorar su vida.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y por medio de esto estar cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Emanuel is a person who works in order to grow and move forward. He wants to be a successful professional who contributes to society.

He is working toward a degree in communications and design. He says that he hopes this career will help him to grow and improve his life.

He is requesting a loan to invest in making payments for college. This will help him get closer to achieving his goal.

loans.use: to make payments for college.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
El Sr. Amado es un hombre luchador que se esta esforzando por salir adelante y crecer en su negocio, este es su tercer crédito con kiva y agradece por las reiteradas oportunidades que esta recibiendo, ya que por medio de ellos pudo invertir en su negocio y crecer.
En este crédito lo quiere invertir en la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser frutas, yerba, panificados, verduras, bebidas y demás, y así seguir trabajando por mejorar y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Amado is a tenacious man who is working hard to get ahead and grow his business.  This is his third loan with Kiva, and he is grateful for the multiple opportunities that he is receiving.  Thanks to these loans, he has been able to invest in his business and grow.

With this loan, he will invest in a variety of products for his store, such as: fruit, yerba tea, bread products, vegetables, drinks, and other items.  This way, he can continue working to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fruit, yerba tea, bread products, vegetables, drinks, and other items

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo tiene 21 integrantes, donde todas se están esforzando por crecer y salir adelante, son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren dar a sus hijos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Una de ellas, y ejemplo de persona es la Sra. Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de choclos, poroto, manteca, etc., y aunque es un trabajo duro, está orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno.
Comenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda en lo que puede a su familia, y asi están saliendo adelante. Ella pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de choclos, poroto, manteca, etc. Y así seguir luchando por crecer.
texts.en:
This communal bank has 21 members.  All of them are working hard to grow and get ahead.  They are female heads of households that want to give their children everything that they were not able to have.  One of them, who is an example of the group, is Maria, who has a business selling maize, kidney beans, butter, and other products.  Although the work is hard, she is proud of what she does, as this is dignified work.

Maria comments that through her work she helps her family as much as she can, and they are getting ahead.  She is requesting this loan to invest in maize, kidney beans, butter, and other products.  This way she can continue to strive for growth.

loans.use: to buy maize, kidney beans, butter, etc.

loans.name: Kuñatau Pora Group

texts.es:
Las 19 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas se está esforzando por poder mejorar sus vidas y la de sus familias. Ellas están muy entusiasmadas de recibir capacitaciones para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Geralda, quien es modista, y con su trabajo está ayudando a si familia. Es una persona muy trabajadora, y comenta que le esa yendo muy bien gracias a que siempre sus clientes están conformes con los trabajos que hace. Su sueño es poder ir mejorando su taller y de esa forma el día de mañana tener un mejor taller para dar trabajo a otras personas que al igual que ella quieren trabajar.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en telas e hilos, y de esa forma seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The 19 members of this group work in a variety of jobs. Each of them is working hard to improve the lives of their families and themselves. They are very enthusiastic to receive training so they can grow and move forward.

One of the members is Geralda, a modest woman. She is helping her family with her work. She is a hard-working person and she mentions that everything is going well because her customers are happy with the work she does. Her dream is to improve her workshop and someday have a better workshop so she can provide jobs to other people like her who want to work.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric and thread. This investment will help her to keep working to improve the lives of her family and herself.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Mujeres Guapas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Guapas está en su ciclo número 7º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien es  vendedora de todo tipo de dulces, como ser maní, choclo, dulce de mamón, etc., se debe destacar el trabajo que ella hace por crecer y por medio de su trabajo poder ayudar a su familia. Es una persona muy luchadora que se esfuerza y quiere salir adelante.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de sus productos tales como maní, y otros tipos de dulces,  lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Guapas" is in its 7th loan cycle with the Program of Women's Committees of Fundacion Paraguaya. All of the members are working and helping each other to get ahead.  They are participating in the Poverty Elimination survey, and they have been found to be below the poverty line.

One of the members of this group is Maria, who has a business selling all types of sweets, such as peanut brittle, sweets made of corn, and candied papayas.  It should be noted that she is working to grow her business, and that through this business she is able to help her family.  Maria is a very tenacious person who works hard because she wants to get ahead.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy products such as: peanut brittle and other types of sweets.  This will help her to carry out her business plan, and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: to buy peanut brittle and other sweets to sell

loans.name: Marvin Ramon

texts.es: Marvin Ramon, mayor de edad soltero con cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, originario de uno de los municipios de chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del pais, donde predomina, la pesca, las playas, es  propietario y administrador de un centro de nintendos el cual vende servicios de video juegos a la población en general al igual que además vende accesorios como: memorias USB, Micro SD, Chips claro y movistar, recargas, refrescos y golosinas, tambien ofrece servicios de quemado de discos e instalaciones de programas para correr video juegos. Y reparaciones de equipos, el inicia su negocio con fondos propios con cuatro equipos completos para tener una fuente de ingresos, los cuales poro a poco ha ido creciendo y dandose a conocer con sus clientes, el desde muy temprano comienza su jornada diaria terminando algo tarde de esa manera el tiene a su clientela contenta. el objetivo de este credito es para invertir en activo fijo compra de una consola play station 3, y de esa manera lograra atraer nueva clientela que disfrute de los juegos en Play station 3 ya que actualmente solo tiene consolas play station 2
texts.en: Marvin Ramon is elderly and single with four adult children.  He is from the Chinandega area, located in the western part of the country, where fishing and beaches dominate.  He is the owner and manager of a Nintendo center where he provides video game services to the general public and where he also sells USB sticks, Micro SD cards, chips, movistar, chargers, soft drinks and snacks.  He also burns CDs, installs video game programs, and repairs equipment.  He started this business with his own capital and four units, so that he could have a source of income.  Little by little  he grew his business.  His shift begins very early every day and he works a bit late, so he has happy customers.  He will use the money from this loan to buy a Play Station 3 console and in this way be able to play these games.  At the moment he only has Play Station 2.

loans.use: to buy a video game console.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
This is fifty-five-year-old Umaru.  He is married and has three children aged ten, fifteen and twenty-eight.

In 1993, Umaru established his textiles and trimmings business. He began his business to be self-reliant after coming from the village.  His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 873,200 SLL every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Umaru requires a loan in order to add to the trimmings stock. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase the stock and expand the business. In the future, Umaru plans to improve the business and expand. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional clothing material and trimmings

loans.name: Sento

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Sento. She is married and has four children, ages five, eight, 14 and 20 years old. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to help with the house chores. In 2002, Sento established her business selling blouses, chains earrings, slippers and trousers. She began her business to be self-reliant and to help her husband with running the affairs of the home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,981,075 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Sento has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to increase her stock of ladies slippers. She hopes that this loan will her to improve the stock and increase profits. In the future, Sento plans to expand the business to a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies slippers.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet Memunatu; she is 35 years-old from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children. In 2008, Memunatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Memunatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and coconuts to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Memunatu plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and coconuts to expand her business.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a 26-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is metal fabrication, the business he started with the vision of surviving and providing for his family. He is mainly facing a challenge of competition whereby he has little stock compared to other competitors. However,he has a vision of having a well roofed house.

Sam intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets for his house that is under construction.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for his house that is under construction.

loans.name: Tophil

texts.en:
Tophil is a 30-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is farming, but he also earns a monthly salary as additional income. He faces the hardships of changes in the weather that affect his profit margin from his crops and also land exhaustion as a result of over farming. However, his vision is to educate his children to higher levels. 

Tophil intends to use the requested loan to buy fertilizers to use on his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to use on his farm.

loans.name: Jibril Ahmed

texts.en: Jibril Ahmed is 24 years old. He studies at Hargeisa University, and is studying Business Administration. He is a Senior student and his problem is the lack of a laptop to use for learning. He needs a laptop to prepared research papers. He cannot pay the cost all at one time. He approached Kaaba MFI and with the loan, Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments. In the future, he wants to earn a Masters degree.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Night Rosemary

texts.en:
Night is a 32-year-old married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda.She owns a retail shop as her main source of income, although she grows and sells produce as her side income. It is from these businesses that she has been able to sustain her family's needs. High rental and license fees are a problem, but she has hopes of expanding her business into a big produce store supplying Kamwenge Town.

Night is requesting for a loan to buy more commodities to sell.

loans.use: to buy more commodities to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 38-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is a retail shop but he also deals in agriculture in order to gain additional income. His challenges include customers who take goods on credit and fail to pay on time as well as price fluctuations. However his vision is to own a wholesale shop and buy land for farming.
 
Robert intends to use the loan to buy more commodities for the shop such as salt, sugar, and paraffin to sell.

loans.use: to buy more commodities for the shop such as salt, sugar, and paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Tajy Poty está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y existe la ayuda mutua entre ellas. Están empezando a trabajar juntas y quieren poder capacitarse para crecer y mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Inocencia, quien además de ser miembro también de este grupo es la presidenta de este grupo. Ella se dedica a hacer comidas que ella misma hace y vende. Comenta que por medio de su esfuerzo está dando a su familia lo que necesitan, y que así no les falte nada. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Ella pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carnes, verduras, condimentos, panificados, aderezos y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende.
texts.en:
The Tajy Poty group is in its first loan cycle in the Women's Committee program. They all work and mutually help each other. They are starting to work together and want to train each other to grow and improve.

One of the members is Inocencia. In addition to being a member, she is the president of the group. She makes a living by cooking meals and then selling them. She says that because of her efforts, she can give her family what they need, and they lack nothing. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying meat, vegetables, condiments, baked goods, seasoning, and more. This will allow her to keep cooking and selling meals.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, baked goods, seasoning, and more.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Las Mercedes está en el 7º ciclo, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde este año cinco integrantes  se encontraban por debajo  de la línea de pobreza.
Aurora, una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de comidas en general como ser empanadas,  sándwich de verduras etc., en su última encuesta se encontraba fuera de la línea de la pobreza, pero de igual manera sigue muy entusiasmada ya que debe mantener sus ingresos.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, huevos, y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con la venta de sus comidas y mejorando sus ingresos cada día. Agradece por esta oportunidad que todas reciben.
texts.en:
The "Las Mercedes" group is in its seventh loan cycle. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, in which this year, five members are below the poverty line. 

Aurora, one of the members, sells a variety of food items such as empanadas, vegetable sandwiches etc. In her last survey, she was above the poverty line, but all the same, she remains very enthusiastic, as she must maintain her income.

She is requesting this loan so that she can purchase various ingredients to continue making her food items, such as vegetables, meats, condiments, eggs, and other items. This way she can continue selling her food and improving her income each day. 

She is grateful for the opportunity they are all receiving.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meats, condiments, eggs, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.en:
Quetzaltenango, located in the Western Highlands of Guatemala, is the second largest city in the country. Nine very energetic, entrepreneurial women joined together in one neighborhood and formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Las Flores” or “The Flowers”. Their goal is not only to improve their own lives but also the lives of their families and their community. The group is about to begin its third loan cycle with Friendship Bridge.

Lisethee, a 53 year old mother of four children, recently joined the group. Two of her four children are already in college and this motivates Lisethee to maintain and develop her small cafeteria, which is part of her home. Quite happily, the business is enjoying increasing success and she has hired two more people to assist her. Lisethee is currently applying for her first loan from Friendship Bridge which she will invest in the cafeteria, buying more cooking supplies as well as staples for food preparation and drinks.

Lisethee appreciates the microcredit and educational program offered by Friendship Bridge. She sees what a huge impact the program has on the lives of women because it allows them to gain the necessary tools to move forward in their lives. They are able to grow in so many ways and give their children opportunities like education, improved nutrition, better health that the women never had as children. In addition, the ladies in the Trust Bank are an important part of the decision-making process which boosts their confidence and self-esteem. In the case of the “Las Flores” Trust Bank, KIVA investors have played a vital role in supplying funding for these essential loans. The women of the Trust Bank look forward to a brighter future as empowered women eliminating poverty!

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies, staples for food preparation, and drinks

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is thirty-seven-year-old Edna.  She is married and has three children aged five, ten and nineteen. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to help a sister with her schooling.

In 1993, Edna established her provisions, drinks, and toiletries business. She began the business to help her husband with running the affairs of the home. Her business is located on the outskirts and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about 1,432,000 SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Edna has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to add to the drinks stock. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve the stock and raise the profits. In the future, Edna plans to improve on the drinks trade by making an extension for the bar and sell recharge cards. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional soft drinks

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.en:
Aquilino is 44 years old and is very responsible with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and three children. He is a farmer who plants palay and beans.

Aquilino wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home. He wishes to live comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs for land cultivation

loans.name: Paula Carolina

texts.es:
Paula Carolina es una joven estudiante de Medicina, ella esta solicitando un prestamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia: Soy Paula Carolina, tengo 18 años de edad,  soy dominicana y vivo en arenoso la vega. Nací en la vega y desde ese entonces he crecido y vivido aquí. Tengo 4 hermanos, vivo con dos de ellos, soy la mas pequeña de mis hermanos. Mi padre trabaja en cotui y mi mamá es ama de casa.

Inicie mis estudio en la universidad católica y tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI), el primer ciclo de medicina y he escogido esta carrera porque siento que cuando sea una doctora ejerceré  con amor y entrega a mis pacientes.  

Necesito el préstamo porque no tengo el dinero para pagar la universidad, y no he podido conseguir una beca, entonces el préstamo es la opción  que necesito para poder ser profesional, ya que sin este no podría estudiar medicina. 

Tengo como meta  es dar el todo por el todo, luchar, esforzarme para que me valla bien en las materias y en mi carrera. Crecer con el tiempo como persona, ayudar a mi familia en un futuro, más a mi madre. Después de terminar la carrera  buscar trabajo como médico general   y evaluar las opciones de hacer una especialidad
texts.en:
Paula Carolina is a young medical student.  She is asking for a loan so she can pay for her studies.  This is her story,

“I’m Paula Carolina.  I’m 18 years old, Dominican, and live in Arenoso La Vega.  I was born and raised in La Vega and have lived here my whole life.  I have four siblings and live with two of them.  I’m the youngest of all my siblings.  My father works in Cotui and my mother is a housewife.  I began studying as a first year medical student at the Catholic and Technology university in Cibao (UCATECI), and I’ve chosen this career because I feel that I will treat my patients with love when I become a doctor.  I need a loan because I don’t have the money to pay the university and I have not been able to get a scholarship.  The loan is the option that I need to be able to become a professional.  Without it I will not be able to continue as a medical student.  I have goals of giving my all, working hard, pushing myself so that things will go well for me in my career, growing as a person over time, and helping my family in the future, especially my mother.  Once I complete my studies, I will look for work as a general practitioner and evaluate specialties.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Mery Del Socorro

texts.es: Mery, a sus 44 años de edad, es madre cabeza de hogar y desde que se separó de su esposo, ha llevado la carga económica de sus tres hijos. Hace algún tiempo tuvo un restaurante que funcionó aproximadamente 6 años, pero las ventas cayeron súbitamente obligándola a cerrar el negocio porque no poseía capital de trabajo para sostenerlo. Actualmente trabaja como empleada en una empresa, desempeñándose como manipuladora de alimentos y, para complementar los ingresos económicos, alterna su empleo con la venta de mercancía, que ofrece a sus familiares, amigos y compañeros, de esta logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar. Su humildad, pujanza y actitud de superación la motivan a solicitar su tercer ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, ropa, accesorios, cremas corporales, entre otros), esto le permitirá abastecerse lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada navideña, dando como resultado un incremento en la entrada de recursos económicos para continuar llevando el sustento a su familia. Mery manifiesta que su principal interés es darle continuidad a su negocio, fortalecerlo y hacerlo más rentable para que le garantice una entrada de recursos estable y así poder brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejores condiciones para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Mery, 44, is a mother and the head of household since she separated from her husband. She takes care of their three children. For about six years, she managed a restaurant, but sales fell sharply, which forced her to close because she didn't have the working capital to sustain the business. She is currently employed at a business, working as a food handler. Also, to complement her income, she works by selling merchandise that she offers to family, friends, and acquaintances. This allows her to pay household expenses.

Mery's humbleness, strength, and attitude of self-improvement motivated her to request her third loan to invest in buying wholesale merchandise (perfume, clothing, accessories, body cream, and more). This will allow her to stock up on the products she needs to satisfy the growing demand during the Christmas season. As a result, this will increase her economic resources so she can continue to support her family. Mery says that her main interest is to keep her business going and make it successful to provide her with stability. Then she will be able to provide her children with a better education and her family with better conditions.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (perfume, clothing, accessories, body cream, and more).

loans.name: Abdirahman Ahmed

texts.en: Abdirahman Ahmed is 24 years old. He studies at University Hargiesa, and is studying Economics. He is Senior student and his problem is the lack of a laptop with which to learn. He needs a laptop to prepare research papers. He cannot afford the cost of a laptop all at one time. He approached Kaaba MFI and Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Abdirahim Ahmed

texts.en: Abdirahim Ahmed is 22 years old. He studies at Admas University College Faculty of Information Technology. His problem is the lack of a laptop and it’s difficult for him to have practical studies. He cannot pay the cost of a laptop all at one time. He requested from Kaaba MFI a laptop as a loan and then Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments. In the future, he hopes to work as Network Administrator.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a wood carver from Ghana who specializes in sculptures and home decor. He would like to invest in new tools and equipment for his workshop. George has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"My carving is motivated by this: I want to record the events of my time. As an animal rights activist and a committed vegetarian, wildlife plays an integral role in my work." George depicts themes from developing countries and comments on the cyclical problem of social confusion and irresolution. He is an observer, struggling to represent the myriad unheard voices that surround him.

"I consider you as the silent or unseen partners to my  business. I am really grateful -- you are making my work easier and more profitable for me."

Use the link below to view George's wood sculptures on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/1291.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and equipment for his workshop

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando expresses his love for nature with colorful wood carvings. He hopes to stock up on raw materials for his sculptures.


Armando has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:


"I learned the art of woodcarving, thanks to my brother, Salvador. For a very long time, this has been the way we bring food to our homes. Sometimes I also work planting coffee, or as a brick mason; I paint houses and give them maintenance. I believe that we should take advantage of all that God gives us to get ahead in life. The most important thing for me is to be more successful day by day, to watch my children grow and to offer them better opportunities through my work."


"I really appreciate this opportunity and want to thank you for the chance to work and be able to feed my family. This money will help me purchase materials at a better price so I can continue working. Thank you!"


Use the link below to view Armando's hand-carved wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:


http://www.novica.com/kiva/8311

loans.use: to stock up on raw materials for his wood sculptures.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa 'zilhi'

texts.en: Carmen Rosa, who signs her silver jewelry as 'Zilhi' in honor of her daughter, is a jewelry designer from Peru. She would like to invest in the purchase of silver and natural gemstones for her jewelry. Zilhi has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is her story: It was through jewelry that Zilhi met her husband. "He taught me so much, and is still by my side, helping me perfect my work and giving me his total support. I find a great deal of satisfaction in my work. For me, my art is a fusion of fantasy and reality. My artistic name, Zilhi, means 'Star.' Now my daughter and I both use this artistic name, as our art is also born from our union." "I am very grateful for your support through this microcredit, because it means I can build up stock in time for the holiday season. These materials will also go toward the development of our new designs, which I'm sure you will like!" Use the link below to view Zilhi's jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/6738

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of silver and natural gemstones for her jewelry

loans.name: Ahmedwali Abdiasis

texts.en:
Ahmedwali Abdiasis is 20 years old. He studies at Gollis University, Faculty of Medicine. 


He is junior student, and his problem is the lack of a laptop to watch video tutorials and for reading medical lessons when given in soft copy. 


He cannot pay the money all at one time. He approached Kaaba MFI; then Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments. 


In the future, he hopes to be a doctor.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Magdalena Del Carmen

texts.es: Magdalena de 22 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una joven muy emprendedora, responsable y visionaria quien a su corta edad tiene mucha práctica en la elaboración de comales y ollas de barro de forma artesanal. Tiene 7 años de dedicarse a este oficio y es así como se gana la vida y ayuda con la economía de su hogar. Desea hacer algunas mejores en su vivienda tales como repello de paredes ya que son a base de adobe, además desea encementar el piso de la casa ya que actualmente es de tierra. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para repellar las paredes y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Magdalena is 22 years old and lives in her own home with her family.  She is a very enterprising, responsible, and visionary young woman who, at her young age, has lots of experience making artesian griddles, and clay pots.  She has been doing this for seven years and earns a living and helps with the household expenses.  She wants to make some improvements to her house, such as repairing the adobe walls.  She also wants to replace the dirt floor with a cement one.  She is asking for this loan through FUSAI, so she can buy cement, sand, and gravel so she can fix up her home.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es: Con 65 años de edad Benito es un hombre muy activo quien se gana la vida trabajando como jornalero y albañil. Para él lo más importante es su querida familia y es por ella que trabaja duramente para llevar el sustento diario. Con mucho esfuerzo dio inicio a la reparación de la casa ya que con el tiempo las paredes y el techo se encontraban en mal estado. Por falta de ingresos no logró dar fin a la reparación del techo por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar el techo de la vivienda y así dar mejores condiciones habitacionales a su querida familia.
texts.en: At age 65, Benito is a very active man who earns a living by working as a laborer and mason.  His family is most important to him and he works to provide daily support.  He was able to begin making repairs to his house with lots of sacrifice, because the roof and walls were in bad shape.  He was not able to finish due to lack of sufficient income, so he is asking for a loan through FUSAI, so he can buy galvanized metal and lumber so he can fix the roof and provide his loving family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal and lumber.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su ciclo 13, gracias al trabajo y a la unión de todas han podido mejorar e ir creciendo. Las capacitaciones que han recibido les ha sido de mucha ayuda y han podido mejorar. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Venancia, quien vende chipas, el cual es un alimento típico paraguayo, y comenta que le está yendo muy bien, ya que las chipas son comidas en toda época del año y gracias a eso se ha hecho de muy buena clientela. Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de chipas y así seguir vendiendo y captando más clientes, y mejorar sus ingresos.
Todas las integrantes están agradecidas por el apoyo que están recibiendo, ya que les permitirá poder ayudar a sus familias, y seguir creciendo y darles una vida digna.
texts.en:
This group is in their 13th cycle and thanks to the work and co-operation between them, all of them have seen improvements and growth. The training they have had has been a lot of help in improving. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight Program and have done the Poverty Elimination survey.

One of the members is Venancia, who sells cheese buns which is a typical food of Paraguay. She says things are going well as the buns are eaten all year long. Thanks to this she has built up a good clientele.

Venancia is requesting this loan to invest in buying cheese buns and continue selling, gaining more clients and increasing her income.

All the members of the group are grateful for the support they are receiving as it allows them to help their families, continue growing and enjoy a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy cheese buns to re-sell.

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven, 56 years old, is married and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has a hog fattening business and this is her source of income. Aside from the hog fattening business, she also had an extra fun time activity vending viand (cooked dishes) that gives her an additional income. 

Through her business, she has had now two children graduate from college. Because of her hard work, Joven, with her husband, successfully educated their children. However, to generate more income and to sustain her family's needs, she applied for a loan of money from Paglaum MPC to buy additional hogs. It would be a great help for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs

loans.name: Jodilee

texts.en:
Jodilee is married and is from Dollops Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is happy tending her little store.

Jodilee wants to support her family and provide a good education to her children.  She has a sari-sari (variety) store business where she has generated income to sustain family needs. With this, she wants to have an additional income. She sees Paglaum MPC as an institution that assists with the financial aspect.

She applied for a loan to buy additional inventory for her egg retailing. Having enough inventory would bring her additional sales.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her egg retailing

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número tres del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
Una de las integrantes es Liz, quien es una excelente vendedora de prenda, y que gracias a la variedad que siempre tiene se ha hecho de muy buena clientela que le hace pedidos. Al principio le fue muy difícil comenzar y hoy en día ya es muy conocida.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de verano, como ser remeras, jeans, shorts y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas, ya que tendrá mejor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group known as " Mujeres Emprendedoras" is in their 3rd cycle of the Woman's Committee Program where everyone works and helps each other in order to get ahead. These people are known in their community as hard-workers.

One of the members is Liz, who is an excellent seller of clothing. Thanks to the variety that she always has, she has gained a good clientele who ask her for things. When she started it was difficult but now she is very well known.

Liz is requesting a loan to invest in buying summer clothing like T-shirts, jeans, shorts, etc. so she will have lots of variety to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, jeans, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa De Hernandarias Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña guapa de Hernandarias está en su 1º ciclo, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, ya que forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, tratando todas ellas de poder mejorar sus vidas y la de su familia.
Gloria, una de integrantes, tiene un kiosco bien surtido, que siempre tiene mucha clientela, y es gracias a ese negocio que está saliendo adelante y está procurando de cada día ir mejorando y crecer para ayudar a su familia. Comenta que lo que atrae a los clientes es la variedad de productos que tiene, y es por eso que pide de este crédito, para poder surtirse con más insumos, como ser golosinas, jugos, gaseosas, etc.
Comenta que quiere seguir trabajando y luchando, es por eso que se esfuerza cada día más.
texts.en:
The group known as "Kuña guapa de Hernandarias" are in their first loan cycle. They are dong the Poverty Elimination Survey, which is part of the Poverty Stoplight Program. They are all trying to better their lives and that of their families.

Gloria, one of the members, has a well-stocked kiosk and always has a lot of clients. She is happy that the business is doing well and she is trying to make it better every day in order to help her family.

She comments that it is the variety of goods that she has that attracts her customers and it is for that reason Gloria has requested a loan. She wants to stock her business with more supplies such as sweets, juice, soft drinks etc. She says she wants to continue working and struggling that is what she labors to do each day.

loans.use: to buy sweets, juice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 30 years old and married, a resident of Ozamiz City, Mindanao, in the Philippines. Her husband's income is not enough to sustain the needs of their family. They have three children, of whom two are in school.  

Starting with capitalization of PHP 2,500, she opened a sari-sari store (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of the Paglaum Cooperative. She was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member this year and has taken out her first loan. 

Now, Christina is applying for PHP 7,000 as her second loan to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  Expanding her inventories would increase her more income. 

She has found assistance for her financial needs through the Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.  Christina deeply wishes to maintain being a credible member in good standing. 

In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and she will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is from Ozamiz City, Misamis Ocidental, Mindanao, in the Philippines. She is 63 years old and single. 

Earlier this year, Leonora applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one.

Recently, she is asking financial assistance of PHP 5,000 to buy additional raw ingredients for her snack vending business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business.  

She has found assistance for her financial needs through the Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart. And she hopes to remain a member in good standing and pledges to repay her obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama mujeres unidas, ya que eso es lo que son todas ellas, mujeres unidas que quieren ayudarse para salir adelante. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están hacienda la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la vida de cada una.
Natalia es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas. Es una persona que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha venido creciendo y mejorando en su emprendimiento. Su meta es poder seguir con sus ventas, y de esa forma luchar por un futuro mejor para su familia.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, jeans, camisas, camisillas, y demás, y así seguir ofreciendo una Buena variedad a sus clientes, lo que le ayudará a seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Mujeres Unidas" (Women United) because that is what they are: women united to help each other get ahead.  They are taking part in the poverty elimination program.  They have all completed the poverty elimination survey which aims to know the circumstances of each member's situation. 
Natalia is one of the members.  She makes her living selling various garments.  With a lot of hard work and sacrifice, she has been growing and improving her business venture.  Natalia's goal is to continue with her sales, and in that way work toward a better future for her family.
Natalia is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of t-shirts, jeans, tops, undershirts and other items so she can keep offering a good variety to her customers.  That will help her to continue improving her income.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, jeans, tops, undershirts and other items.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel is 34 years old and lives in San Pedro Pagadian City. He is a single father, with two children.

To earn a living, Rodel drives a motorcycle.  Each month he earns PHP 8,000.  He has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to finance an ice cream business.

He has been a member of PMPC for four months. In the future he hopes to have his own business and to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: To finance an ice cream business

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 50 years old and lives in Tickwas, Dumalinao, ZDS. She is married, with two children.                    

Lucila has a shop that sells ready-to-wear and cosmetic products. She has had this business for six years.  She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more stocks of ready-to-wears and cosmetics.                                                    

Lucila has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Lucila hopes to open a branch from another municipality.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wears and cosmetics

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado Nueva Esperanza es un grupo nuevo, que está en su primer ciclo, ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas, y quieren que por medio de las capacitaciones que van a recibir puedan mejorar sus vidas.
Una persona que se destaca por su esfuerzo es la Sra. Maria, quien vende helados variados, y con ello tiene los ingresos para ayudar a su familia, y comenta que en época de verano es cuando mas ventas tiene, y que así se hace de mayor clientela cada vez.
En vista de que se acerca el verano y hace mucho calor, ella pide de este crédito para poder comprar helados de distintos sabores, ya que quiere seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y su familia esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group known as "Nueva Esperanza" is a new group in their 1st loan cycle. They are learning to work together. They want to improve their lives through the training they are receiving. 

One member who stands out for her effort is Maria who sells a variety of ice-cream. From this she earns the money to help her family. She comments that in the summer she has the most sales and that her clientele is expanding all the time. Seeing that summer is coming and it is hot she is requesting a loan to buy ice-cream of a variety of flavors. Then she can continue to sell. She is grateful for the opportunity that is being given to her and her family.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream to re-sell.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
Rosa Mistica está en su ciclo número 2° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas son jefas de familia, que quieren dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Alguien digno de destacar es Maria, quien tiene una hamburguesería, en la que trabaja y lucha diariamente, y comenta que se está haciendo de muy buena clientela ya que sus productos son muy ricos. Ella quiere poder tener un negocio amplio de comidas, y así también poder dar trabajo a otras personas que al igual que ella quieren salir adelante.
Maria pide de este crédito para la compra de huevos, verduras, aderezos y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas. Este grupo está agradecido por la ayuda que está recibiendo que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rosa Mistica" (Mystic Rose) is in its 2nd funding cycle with the women's committee.  They all work together and help each other to get ahead.  The members are mothers who want to give their families what they themselves weren't able to have. 
A member worth mentioning is Maria.  She has a burger bar where she works, and works hard, every day.  She says that she is building up a very good clientele, as her products are quite delicious.  Maria wants to have an expanded food business and also be able to employ other people who, like herself, want to get ahead. 
Maria is asking for this loan to purchase eggs, vegetables, seasonings and other supplies to keep going with her sales.  The members of this communal bank are grateful for the help they are receiving; it is allowing them to continue to grow.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, vegetables, seasonings and other items to keep up with her burger bar.

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Victoria está en su ciclo número 3. Las integrantes del comité han formado un grupo unido y estable, gracias al esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo de todas, así como el respeto y solidaridad que todas se deben unas a otras.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Perla, quien solicita de este crédito para la compra de huevos y frutas, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de los mismos. Es una persona muy trabajadora, y comenta que es el sostén de su familia.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le permitirá seguir creciendo e invirtiendo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The "La Victoria" group is in their 3rd cycle. The members of the committee form a stable and united group thanks to the efforts and continual work of all of them. Also they respect and feel solidarity with each other.

One of them is Perla who is requesting a loan to buy eggs and fruit, which will help her realize her business plan. This will help her increase her income as this is what she sells. She is a hard-working person and she comments that this is the main support for her family.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving which will allow her to continue to grow and invest in her work.

loans.use: to buy eggs and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Tikal Group

texts.en:
The rural area of Chichicastenango is full of cultural traditions which are exemplified in the beautiful and colorful clothing of the area. Many of the eight women who form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Tikal” create handmade textiles including ornate blouses called “huipiles”, and other creations. Other women work in animal husbandry.

Tomasa is a 38-year-old widow and is the Secretary of the Trust Bank. The group is in its third loan cycle. She has been a widow for eight years and works diligently to take care of the basic needs of her five children. Tomasa raises animals including chickens and pigs. She is quite happy to receive a new loan which she will use to purchase 20 additional chickens and 2 pigs. She will also buy feed to fatten them. Her dream is to increase her business, creating more income so that she can continue to support her family. As many of the women in the Friendship Bridge program, Tomasa wants her children to complete their education, something that she was unable to do. At the present time, one child attends the 2nd grade, two are in 4th grade, and the last one is in 6th grade. Tomasa only reached the 4th grade.

Tomasa shares that she enjoys being a part of this Trust Bank. She feels empowered because she participates in making decisions and has learned many new things. Each month at the meetings of the “Tikal” Trust Bank, the women receive trainings on subjects like money management, indebtedness, women’s health and hygiene and medicinal plants. Armed with these new tools, Tomasa and her fellow Trust Bank members face a more prosperous and happier future for themselves, their families, and their community in the rural area of Chichicastenango.

loans.use: to purchase 20 additional chickens and 2 pigs

loans.name: Xejuyu Concepcion Group

texts.en:
Conception Sololá, located in Western Guatemala, is known as a valley of indigenous people of Maya-Kakchiquel ethnicity. It is an agricultural area where men, women and children are growing good quality vegetables. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Xejuyu Concepción,” (meaning “Below the Haze of Conception”) has been located in this region for the last five years. The Trust Bank is composed of seven women who mostly work in agriculture as well as the manufacture of beaded jewelry and ornaments. Two other women have small shops for daily consumption items and a “tortilleria” where tortillas are freshly available three times each day.

Rosario is the 33 year old mother of 5 children. Sadly, she became a widow one year ago when her husband suffered an accident and died. So, Rosario became both mother and father to her children and needed to spend more time and energy for her agricultural business. Rosario is in her third loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. She states, “I was relieved when I knew I could get micro-loans through Friendship Bridge because it is not easy for other institutions to give loans to widows, and even less if that woman is a farmer." Rosario is currently applying for a new loan, which she will use to buy seeds to grow potatoes, onion, carrot, as well as fertilizers.

Both Rosario and the rest of the ladies in the Trust Bank want to share that being a part of the “Xejuyu Concepcion” as united them even more. Previously, they were just neighbors but now they are friends, companions, confidants and much more. They support each other and practice solidarity. The women want to express their thanks to KIVA investors because without this vital financial support, they would be unable to grow and empower themselves. The benefits trickle down to their families and their community as well. It is a “win-win” situation!

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow potatoes, onions, carrots, as well as fertilizers.

loans.name: Atiocoyo Ix Group

texts.es:
Alcira es una agricultora de 28 años de edad del departamento de La Libertad,pertenece al grupo solidario llamado Atiocoyo IX,los cuales se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado.

Alcira esta acompañada, estudio hasta segundo grado, pues tuvo la necesidad de trabajar desde niña para colaborar a la economia familiar, ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos economicos. Tiene cuatro hijos entre las edades de 5 a 15 años de los cuales los tres menores estan actualmente en la escuela.

Alcira se dedica desde hace 10 años, al cultivo de maiz, frijol,maicillo y a la crianza de ganado, este trabajo le ha permitido poder sostener economicamente a su familia. Solicita el prestamo para comprar ganado, alimentarlo y luego venderlo ya que con esto, ella espera obtener una muy buena ganancia para mejorar la economia de su grupo familiar y poder asi brindarle a sus hijos las oportunidades de estudio que ella no tuvo para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alcira is a 28-year-old farmer from La Libertad department. She belongs to a solidarity group called Atiocoyo IX. They all make their living as farmers and in animal husbandry.

Alcira has a partner. She studied up to the second grade because she has had to to work since she was a child in order to help out with the family finances as her parents had little money. She has four children between the ages of 5 and 15 years old and the three oldest are currently in school.

For 10 years Alcira has made a living growing corn, beans, and sorghum as well as raising animals. This work has allowed her to support her family financially. She is requesting a loan to buy cattle, feed them, and then sell them. As a result of this she hopes to make a good profit and improve her family's finances. She also hopes to be able to give her children the opportunity to study that she did not have and that they have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cows and feed them for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria viene de una familia humilde, tiene una heladería donde trabaja toda la familia y recorren en forma ambulante por eventos deportivos. Ella aparte de trabajar también está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería comercial y comenta que su aspiración es terminar  su carrera y comenzar a trabajar en algo de la rama y de esa manera ser una buena profesional, también tener un ingreso más para su hogar.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de transporte, ya que le permitirá seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Maria comes from a humble family that has an ice cream shop where the whole family works. They also sell as streets vendors for sporting events. In addition to working, she is also studying the commercial engineering curriculum. She comments that her goal is to finish her studies and begin to work in some position in that area and in this way be a good professional, and also to have a better income for her household.

She is asking for this loan to invest it in her transportation costs, since it will allow her to continue working toward her goals.

loans.use: to pay for transportation expenses

loans.name: Rony

texts.es:
El Señor Rony está casado, tiene 35  años de edad, es comerciante y comenta que tiene una librería y fotocopiadora en su casa, y que su esposa la Sra. Maria hace accesorios y artesanías para la venta en su librería.
Comenta que con mucho esfuerzo tanto él como su esposa están luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de  vida, y así poder crecer en su negocio.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en insumos para su librería, como ser cuadernos, libros, lápices, marcadores y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que el y su esposa están recibiendo. En la foto del préstamo aparecen ambos, el Sr. Rony y su esposa que es la codeudora.
texts.en:
Rony is 35 years old and married. He is a businessperson, and says he has a bookstore and photocopier in his home, and that his wife Maria makes accessories and crafts to sell in his bookstore. 

He says that with a great deal of effort, both he and his wife are striving to improve their living conditions and see their business grow. He is requesting this loan so that he can invest it in supplies for his bookstore, such as notebooks, books, pens, markers and other items, and this way be able to continue selling.

He is grateful for this opportunity that he and his wife are receiving.  In the loan photo both appear; Rony and his wife, who is the co-borrower.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, books, pens, markers and other items.

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
La Sra. Paulina es una mujer muy emprendedora, tiene una despensa bien surtida que por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo ha podido montar. Es muy luchadora y se está esforzando por poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
Su objetivo es agrandar su local, y a medida que pase el tiempo que sus clientes estén contentos y cada vez tenga mejores ingresos gracias a ellos.  Ella pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas, verduras, productos a granel, carnes, bebidas y demás.
texts.en:
Señora Pablina is a very entrepreneurial woman. She has a well-stocked shop that she has been able to set up through her work and effort. She is very hard-working, and she is striving to be able to give her family everything that they need. 

Her goal is to enlarge her store, and as time goes on and her customers are happy, she will have better and better income thanks to them. She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of fruits, vegetables, bulk products, meats, beverages, and other items.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, bulk products, meats, beverages, and other items

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es:
El señor Reinerio tiene 30 años, es soltero y vive con su madre en la ciudad de Carapeguá, comenta que desde joven empezó a salir a vender las colchas que ellos mismos producen con su mamá, después de 6 años se independizó y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia. 
Lleva los productos artesanales a venderlos por las ciudades de Villa Elisa y Asunción, transportándose en su motocicleta que gracias  a este trabajo logró comprarse y también comenta que el ayuda a su mama.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Reinerio is 30 and single. He lives with his mother in the city of Carapeguá. He says that from a young age he began to go out and sell bedspreads that he and his mother produce. After six years he went out on his own and began to work on his own account.

He brings artisanal products to sell around the cities of Villa Elisa and Asunción, getting around in his motorcycle which thanks to this work he managed to buy, and he also says that he helps his mother.

He is requesting the loan to buy hammocks, blankets and sheets, as he has many orders for these products.

loans.use: To buy hammocks, blankets and sheets.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 66 years old and lives in Guipos, Zamboanga del Sur. She is widowed with six children. Lolita has a shop that sells cloth and dressmaking supplies for products. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for six years. She requested a loan of 10,000 pesos to pay for dressmaking supplies. In the future, Lolita hopes to have more dressmaking supplies.

loans.use: to pay for dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva es una persona muy trabajadora, que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio esta trabajando, es muy luchadora, y cada día que pasa es consciente que debe seguir trabajando. Su anterior crédito de kiva lo uso para poder comprar bebidas, gaseosas, comestibles, etc., lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo crédito, el cual quiere invertir en la compra de mas insumos, como ser gaseosas, frutas, golosinas, y demás, ya que por medio de su negocio podrá seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Elva is a very hard-working person, who is working with much effort and sacrifice. She works hard, and with every passing day she is conscious that she must continue working. She used her previous loan from Kiva to buy beverages, soft drinks, food products, etc., which were a great help to her. Now she is asking for a new loan, which she wants to invest in the purchase of more supplies, such as soft drinks, fruits, candies, and other items, since through her business she will be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, fruits, candies, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen del Carmen está en el 1º ciclo  del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. La mayoría de las integrantes realizan actividades productivas y las que no, tienen el deseo de emprender una actividad para poder así ir aumentando sus ingresos.
Una de las integrantes la Sra. Heidi se dedica a la elaboración y venta de especias, y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de hierbas naturales.  Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called "Virgen de Carmen" is in its first loan cycle in the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women program, where everyone works and helps the others to advance. The majority of the members have productive activities, and those who don't have the desire to undertake a business activity to thus be able to increase their income.

One of the members of Señora Heidi. She prepares and sells spices, and she is applying for the loan to buy natural herbs. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy natural herbs to make spices.

loans.name: Saidhuja

texts.ru: Саидхуча 1991 года рождения. В 2009 году он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет  на юридический  факультет на договорное очное отделение. Сумма договора составляет 900 долларов США. По окончания университета он мечтает стать юристом. До поступления в университет он учился в средней школе.  Саидхуча получил среднее образование. У него имеется аттестат с хорошими оценками. Саидхуча не женат и живет с родителями и братьями. Их 5 человек в семье. Все члены семьи имеют высшее образование. Его родители не в состоянии оплатить за учебу в университет. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 900 долларов США для оплаты учебы. Он ждет вашу помощь.
texts.en: Saidhuja was born in 1991. Since 2009 he has been attending Tajik State University. He is a law student at the outreach school. The tuition for the outreach school is 900 US dollars. After finishing the university Saidhuja dreams of becoming a lawyer. Before attending the university Saidhuja attending high school and received a high school diploma. He got very good grades. Saidhuja is not married and lives with his parents and brothers, five people total and all family members have a college degree. His parents can't pay for Saidhuja's education. That is why he is requesting a loan of 900 US dollars to pay for his tuition. Saidhuja hopes for your assistance.

loans.use: to pay for his college tuition

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is married with three children. Sofia is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines.                           

Sofia is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizers.                                                                  

Sofia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Sofia hopes to harvest more corn crops through the Paglaum Co-op (PMPC).

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria earns a living through tailoring  services.  She is 58 years old, married with five children and lives in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. She is now well known for the nice quality of tailoring services she offers and is able to save from her work. Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 5,000 per month.
  
Eleuteria is seeking a PHP 10,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase a new sewing machine for her dress-making business. This is a regular loan and would be repaid in a few months. In her two previous loans, she has never had a delinquency.  Eleuteria is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Begimjan

texts.ru: Бегимжан 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 2 сыновей. Старший сын живет и работает в столице Кыргызстана, помогает материально своей семье, а младший проживает с родителями, помогает по хозяйству. У Бегимжан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бегимжан занимается животноводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бегимжан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется:15 овец. Бегимжан занимается перепродажей овец на местном скотном рынке. Закупает овец, откармливает их и перепродает на рынке по высокой цене. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бегимжан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене.
